      Calls mileageVbo(GL, double, double) with a threshold of 1+epsilon.
      GLStreamingBuffer mileageVbo(javax.media.opengl.GL gl, double ppvAspectRatio, double ppvAspectRatioChangeThreshold)
      Recomputes mileages as necessary (based on the given threshold, and on the change in ppv-aspect-ratio), then returns the mileage VBO.

      • closeLoop

        public void closeLoop()
        After calling this method, client code must next call moveTo(float, float, float), before calling either lineTo(float, float) or closeLoop() again.

        public void clear()

        Convenience method for adding an axis-aligned rectangle.

      • addPolygon

        public void addPolygon(float... xys)
        Convenience method for adding a polygon.

        Use of varargs makes this method convenient, but may also make it inefficient in some cases, since the args must be passed in a float[] array.

      • dispose

        public void dispose(javax.media.opengl.GL gl)
        Disposes buffers on host and device.

        This object must not be used again after this method has been called.

      • numVertices

        public int numVertices()

      • xyVbo

      • mileageVbo

        public GLStreamingBuffer mileageVbo(javax.media.opengl.GL gl,
                                    double ppvAspectRatio)
        Calls mileageVbo(GL, double, double) with a threshold of 1+epsilon.

      • mileageVbo

        public GLStreamingBuffer mileageVbo(javax.media.opengl.GL gl,
                                    double ppvAspectRatio,
                                    double ppvAspectRatioChangeThreshold)
        Recomputes mileages as necessary (based on the given threshold, and on the change in ppv-aspect-ratio), then returns the mileage VBO.

      • rawMileageVbo

        public GLStreamingBuffer rawMileageVbo(javax.media.opengl.GL gl)
        Returns the mileage VBO without recomputing the mileage values. This is useful when meaningful values are not required, such as when rendering with stippling disabled.
